FIP_maDMP_Mapping.FIP_question: What globally unique, persistent, resolvable identifiers do you use for metadata records?
FIP_maDMP_Mapping.Comments: Convenient web-based retrieval based on assigned material ID. e.g. <https://materialsproject.org/materials/mp-1234>. | provided by funder. DOIs via DataCite.
Allowed_values: U.S. Department of Energy Office of Scientific and Technical Information (OSTI) Data ID Service

FIP_maDMP_Mapping.FIP_question: What globally unique, persistent, resolvable identifiers do you use for datasets?
FIP_maDMP_Mapping.Comments: URLs for raw data minted and served by NOMAD Laboratory <https://nomad-lab.eu/>.

FIP_maDMP_Mapping.FIP_question: Which metadata schemas do you use for findability?
FIP_maDMP_Mapping.Comments: The OSTI DOI Identifier Service (http://purl.org/np/RAyIQx7rn1CDYgTqRlSbsZY0yQz46VxRzSgfMp138QInM) provides a schema.org Dataset profile via DataCite. | http://datacite.org/schema/kernel-4 is provided

FIP_maDMP_Mapping.FIP_question: What is the technology that links the persistent identifiers of your data to the metadata description?
FIP_maDMP_Mapping.Comments: Links from data are either to material DOIs via https://doi.org/ URLs or material entities via https://materialsproject.org/ URLs.

FIP_maDMP_Mapping.FIP_question: In which search engines are your metadata records indexed?
FIP_maDMP_Mapping.Comments: OSTI sends stuff here (via DataCite?) | Seemed like a good idea to register here.

FIP_maDMP_Mapping.FIP_question: Which usage license do you use for your metadata records?
Which usage license do you use for your datasets?
